reviews.review_msg: Tough grader, very unfair marker,She gives two quizzes a week, her tests and exams are extremely hard,she is very picky,Would not recommend to take her as a prof

Very nice teacher, but be prepared to study hard. She gives two quizzes per week. One online, and one in class. Given that there is only one day in between to study for these quizzes, they are extremely hard and specific, making it very unfair

Went out of her way to help me with an administrative mix-up so I could actually take the course! Very polite but fair. I enjoyed her lectures. My one complaint is the group assignment toward the end of the course - but that's more an issue with the other students in the course.
Nicole is super funny and nice. The class was pretty easy too but sometimes she goes off on tangents or is really disorganized. Easily flustered but she means well

Unlike most people I really didn't like Nicole as a prof. I also took BISC300 with her and both classes turned out to be some of my most boring. She often answers questions with "I don't know" and makes many mistakes which she then giggles about. Her facts are based upon Wikipedia and she acts like she is a student - not a professor.
Easiest mid term ever. Didn't really need to study as long as you attended lecture and did home work.

Nicole is amazing. Had her for BISC204 as well. Never any surprises on her exams and doesn't just test memorized facts, she wants you to apply it to other situations. Didn't use the textbook at all. Just her notes are enough to get you through with a good grade.

So enthusiastic and animated that it's cute.  Always happy to help and in general, a very nice prof who isn't trying to fail you all.  However, she never finishes her lectures so she ended up lecturing about last week's readings.  Otherwise, she's fab and fair.
One of the most kind and wonderful personalities for a prof - taking her class is just amazing

Nicole is a great professor, her lectures are clear and interesting, her exams are fair and fairly comprehensive, and her notes accompanied with her audio-recorded lectures that she posts online make the course easy to follow and also to catch up on if you fall behind.

One of the best biology profs in my opinion, notes and lectures were crystal clear, didnt even need to use the textbook for the entire semester. exams were tough but fair. I would totally recommend her! she really cares about her class and tries to make it fun!
interesting lecture, easy to study and get along with.

Excellent prof, very helpful, easy to talk to:).Loves biology and puts alot of effort into her teaching. The only q's she answered with "I don't know" were ones that were off-topic(crazy right?lol).Goes through alot of material so attend lecs AND labs as she clarifies what she wants you to know - applied q's on exams are the most difficult.

Although a lot of people here seem to think Tunbridge is great I strongly disagree. She wasn't really capable of answering a lot of basic questions and would simply answer 'I don't know.' Some of her midterm and exam questions were misleading and actually quite ridiculous. Her level of incompetence is a huge part of the reason i changed majors.
I wasn't sure what to expect in my first university science course, but Nicole made it a great experience. She is a lovely professor.
This is the best professor I have had. She tries her best to teach this course. Very nice!
If you're looking for some eye candy profs well you got one right here. She's def hot and you will enjoy your class. Oh yeah the material was fine.

Excellent lecturer. Although each problem set was worth far too much, you will come out the class satisfied with your grade and have a real understanding of the material. TEXTBOOK NOT NEEDED AT ALL!!!!!

Overall, she was a really good prof. Her first midterm was a bit tough, but the second was too easy, and the final was totally 100% fair. She doesn't try to trick you at all - but she wants really specific details. The ta's were a little bit on the picky side, but as an overall course it was really well done.

Dr. Tunbridge is really enthusiastic about the material and genuinely interested in helping students - answered a ton of my questions on a late night right before the exam! One of the things I really appreciated was that she references classic papers from literature and also keeps students informed of volunteering opportunities in the department.

Overall she is a good lecturer, but isn't the easiest to get a high grade with. Love that she is open to feedback and enthusiastic. She focuses on understanding in exams which makes them harder. Ohh and all her exams were long answer, no multiple choice.

She teaches well but she expect so much from you in exams. She makes her exams hard so that the average remains low.She gives assignment we don't really need. I used to like her. now I just despise her. I just want to be done with her class & never see her again

Ok, there were A LOT of materials to study. Exams seem easy but she wants high expectations on the answers so difficult overall. I spent so much time preparing for studying for this course and I think I put my effort like A+ level but I got a B- at the end of the term. This is what this course is like. Good luck people...

Midterm was killer. Final exam was not too hard if you put in time to study. Lab final was annoying but easy to pass (and do good) if you study. Make sure you know the lab inside out before going into it and you'll be fine. Is a great prof; explains things well and really nice and helpful. Can do really good in the class if you put in the time.

Jesus christ the FINAL is just brutal. she packed wayy to much material into it and for a first year course i feel like its too much, really. studied the best i could but still ended up bsing lots of questions :( also its annoying how u must pass lab exam to pass course. do 100 level bio courses hav to be this hard?
bad at explaining lecture materials, hard miterm
Midterm was really difficult for a 100 level course. Lab exam was pretty hard and the fact that you need to pass the lab exam to pass the entire course is pretty ridiculous. Overall decent prof.

She actually wants students to do well and you can tell you has enthusiasm to teach and for biology. COVERS A LOT, BE AWARE! Labs can be a pain, too much to do in those 3 hours and they expect u to kno everything! Certain T.A.s are useless. Her midterms are HARD AS HECK though and I'm guessing the FINAL will be brutal. I think BIO 101 is  better

covers alot of material, class lecture is confusing at times, midterm is easy, lab final is studied hard is easy..FINAL IS VERY HARD SO STUDY UR BRAINS OUT b/c the writtern part you have to be clear in explanation (IF SAME AS BOOK THEN GOOD). also tutorial was a waste of time...ps payattention to guest lecturers

She is the best Bisc prof ever! She is quite the looker too! She like handled everything: lab, lecture etc..yeah it is too bad she is leaving :( Though, the final was harder than expected. Like every other course, study on a regular basis and you'll pass.
Very helpful. Lab exam was pretty simple. Study notes very well for the final!

this course covers toooo much material, that she should have trimmed it down but she didnt. the first midterm was way too long, and very difficult. Lab exam was not bad, but difficulty was random since there were 20 stations, u were given a number n u only need to do 4. final was pretty hard, even the short answers part require critical thinking.
Awesome professor who is amazing at breaking up the work into understandable bits. Too bad shes leaving SFU for a while.
Excellent speaker, shes also lab instructor so there is no confusion between lecture and lab materials. plus shes hot as hell!
